body:
Needed as a follow-up to #26351 

Most of the currently supported clouds that offer special volume types provide a deterministic way to determine the path that a volumes is attached to on a node. (GCE, OpenStack, VSphere).  There is at least one cloud that does not - AWS.  For AWS, this information is only available via an API call.  In order to facilitate AWS and future clouds that do not offer such a deterministic way to know the path of a volume, a mechanism is needed to store the path where a volume is attached to a host when that host's volumes are managed by the attach/detach controller, so that the Kubelet has enough information to mount the attached volume for a pod(s) to use without requiring credentials on the node.

@saad-ali and I discussed using an annotation on the volume, perhaps `kubernetes.io/attach-path`.  Example:

``` yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolume
metadata:
  name: pv-1gb
  labels:
    type: ebs
  annotations:
    kubernetes.io/attach-path: /dev/xvd1
spec:
  capacity:
    storage: 1Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteMany
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  awsElasticBlockStore:
    volumeID: vol-YYYYY
    fsType: xfs
```

When a node is managed by the attach/detach controller, the Kubelet will need to wait for this annotation to be present on the volume before mounting it.
